definition: person who writes articles - newspapers, magazines, blogs (informal)/scribe/copyist/a talented writer of articles or of calligraphy
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The runup in business school applications during the recession has created a windfall for essay writers.
sentences.chinese: 衰退期間湧現的商學院申請令論文寫手大發橫財。

sentences.english: Experienced writers who can rate a 5 and find assignments can dowell here too.
sentences.chinese: 能被分到5組的老到寫手，自然也能在這找到好處。

sentences.english: In someone's opinions, the keyboard becomes a medium of expression for the young writer's rebelliousness.
sentences.chinese: 在一些人看來，網絡成了年輕寫手彰顯叛逆的媒介。

sentences.english: Do you have a team of writers and project managers, or you and an intern?
sentences.chinese: 你是否有寫手和項目經理，還是你和一個實習生？

sentences.english: A good developer and designer, then, is more than a coder.
sentences.chinese: 出色的開發人員和設計人員不僅僅是代碼寫手。

sentences.english: Monika is a passionate freelance writer and pro-blogger.
sentences.chinese: 莫妮卡是熱情的自由作家和博客寫手。

sentences.english: The writers of the Onion are unencumbered by any obvious party loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 洋蔥新聞的寫手不向任何黨派示忠心。

sentences.english: Make a mistake, and a swarm of furious pyjama-clad scribes will pounce.
sentences.chinese: 一旦出錯，就會有一羣穿着睡衣橫眉豎眼的寫手衝來。

sentences.english: Today we're debuting two new writers on ReadWriteWeb.
sentences.chinese: 今天讀寫網將推出兩位新寫手。

sentences.english: It’s an award for our writer, for the consultant, it’s kind of encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 這是對我們的寫手和諮詢師的一種獎勵和鼓勵。

sentences.english: I am an excellent obituary writer because I am clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 我是一流的訃告寫手，因爲我是千里眼。

definition: unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
Alai (1959-), ethnic Tibetan Chinese writer, awarded Mao Dun Literature Prize in 2000 for his novel 塵埃落定|尘埃落定[Chen2 ai1 luo4 ding4] "Red Poppies"
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
